info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 2 at 7:28PM EDT until May 2 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Morristown TN
info.description:
At 728 PM EDT, Local law enforcement reported they were responding to multiple flooding related emergencies, and social media pictures and videos showed upwards of 2 feet of water on Hixson Pike. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen over the last three hours due to thunderstorms. Flash flooding is expected to continue.
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Law enforcement reported.
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Chattanooga, Soddy-Daisy, Signal Mountain, Walden, Lakesite, Ridgeside, Fairmount, Harrison, Red Bank, Falling Water, Middle Valley, East Ridge, North Chickamauga Creek Gorge, Lookout Mountain, Harrison Bay State Park and Mowbray Mountain.
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHWESTERN HAMILTON COUNTY
NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 10:00 PM EDT. Avoid flooded areas.

National Weather Service: A FLASH FLOOD WARNING is in effect for this area until 10:00 PM EDT. This is a dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHWESTERN HAMILTON COUNTY
SNM: AVISO DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS hasta 10:00 PM EDT. Evite areas inundadas.

Servicio Nacional de Meteorologia: AVISO DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS en efecto para esta area hasta las 10:00 PM EDT. Esta es una situacion peligrosa y amenaza la vida. No intente viajar a menos que sea para abandonar un area propensa a inundaciones o bajo una orden de desalojo.
